thread.title: GM’s Profit Sinks on Restructuring, Other Costs

author: Mike Colias
title: GM’s Profit Sinks on Restructuring, Other Costs
text:
General Motors Co.’s first-quarter net income sank 60% amid hefty restructuring costs in South Korea and lost production in the U.S. from planned factory downtime, but the auto maker handily beat Wall Street profit forecasts.
GM on Thursday reported net income attributable to common shareholders of $1 billion for the January-to-March period, down from $2.6 billion a year earlier. The result reflected nearly $1 billion in restructuring costs mostly related to GM’s operations in Korea, where the auto maker is closing a plant... RELATED VIDEO In the Elevator With GM CEO Mary Barra WSJ's Joanna Stern "bumps" into General Motors CEO Mary Barra in the WSJ elevator and asks about self-driving cars, NAFTA and how GM is diversifying its workforce. Photo: Jeff Bush/The Wall Street Journal
